place.name: ELERCH
place.gazetteerText: ELERCH, a chapelry in Llanbadarnfawr parish, Cardigan; 2 miles SE of Aberystwith. It was constituted in 1868. The living is a p. curacy. Value, £150. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
